results.title: Both lisinopril and verapamil reduced platelet-derived growth factor-A chain mRNA levels in human saphenous vein endothelial cells stimulated by thrombin.
results.text_hl: CONCLUSIONS: These data suggest that one means by which @<m>CHEMICAL_Lisinopril</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D017706 @@@lisinopril@@@ and @CHEMICAL_Verapamil @CHEMICAL_MESH:D014700 @@@verapamil@@@ both suppress @<m>DISEASE_Synovitis</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D013585 @@@intimal thickening@@@ might be inhibition of @GENE_PDGFA @GENE_5154 @@@PDGF-A@@@ chain gene expression in ECs regrowing over @DISEASE_Cushing's_symphalangism @DISEASE_MESH:C536223 @@@vessel injury@@@ areas that are sites of @GENE_F2 @GENE_2147 @@@thrombin@@@ generation.

citations.NLM: Yamaguchi M, Gallati H, Baur W, Cruess DF, Sharefkin JB. Both lisinopril and verapamil reduced platelet-derived growth factor-A chain mRNA levels in human saphenous vein endothelial cells stimulated by thrombin. Surgery. 1994 Apr;115(4):495-502. PMID: 8165541
